clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Periodontal Treatment on Salivary Biomarkers
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Periodontal Treatment on Salivary Biomarkers.

lead_sponsor.agency: The Baruch Padeh Medical Center, Poriya

clinical_study.source: The Baruch Padeh Medical Center, Poriya

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators plan to recruit 40 healthy patients referred to the unit of Periodontology, diagnosed with generalized moderate - severe chronic periodontitis.
treatment will include 4 - 6 sessions of scaling + root planning, oral hygiene instructions and motivation.
Whole saliva will be collected at intake and 8 - 14 weeks post periodontal treatment.
Saliva will be analyzed for trans locator protein. Study hypothesis: Periodontal treatment has an affect on saliva components.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Intake of patients than 8 - 12 weeks after periodontal treatment (scaling & root planning)
primary_outcome.description: Change in whole saliva & translocator protein (TSPO) post periodontal treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Periodontal measurements (periodontal pocket depth, bleeding on probing & clinical attachment level)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Intake 8 - 12 weeks post periodontal treatment (scaling & root planning)
secondary_outcome.description: periodontal probing depth, bleeding on probing and clinical attachment level.

intervention.intervention_name: periodontal treatment - scaling and root planning

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy patients
- moderate - sever chronic periodontitis
Exclusion Criteria:
- systemic disease
- pregnancy
- subjects under the age of 18
